snippet: Edward J. Snowden’s assignment as an “infrastructure analyst” helps explain how he could lay bare the National Security Agency’s efforts to identify potential targets.
abstract: Edward J Snowden reveals to The Guardian that his official role at National Security Agency involved aggressive search for new ways to break into Internet and telephone traffic around world; details explain how Snowden obtained documents laying bare agency's top-secret capabilities; Guardian also reveals that 38 international embassies and missions were NSA targets, drawing furious protests from European officials.

byline.original: By SCOTT SHANE and DAVID E. SANGER

lead_paragraph: Edward J. Snowden’s assignment as an “infrastructure analyst” helps explain how he could lay bare the National Security Agency’s efforts to identify potential targets.

headline.main: Job Title Key to Inner Access Held by Snowden
headline.print_headline: Job Title Key To Inner Access Held by Leaker
